did.unittitle: Frederick W. Chesson Connecticut Iron Industry Collection.
did.abstract: Resident of Waterbury, Connecticut, and historian of Connecticut business and industry. Collection includes collected literature about the early iron industry in the United States, particularly Massachusetts, Connecticut, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Frederick W. Chesson is a resident of Waterbury, Connecticut, a collector of documents about Connecticut's business and industrial history, and the author of three books about the Connecticut cities of New Haven, Waterbury and Woodbury.

item.bibref: New Haven: from the collection of Charles Rufus Harte, Dover, N.H. : Arcadia, 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of notes, writings, correspondence, photographs, and newspaper clippings created or gathered by Charles Rufus Harte and Herbert Cary Keith, presumably in preparation for their writing of the book The Early Iron Industry in Connecticut, written in 1935. While the main focus of the materials in the collection are on the early iron industry in Connecticut, there is also information about the iron industry in Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania, particularly the Hopewell Furnace.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut business history. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
